info.name: Vagal trigone
info.description: The vagal trigone is a small surface elevation in the caudal floor of the fourth ventricle, just lateral to the hypoglossal trigone. The elevation is produced by the underlying dorsal motor nucleus of the vagus. The vagal and hypoglossal trigones are part of the median eminence which lies medial to the sulcus limitans
info.item: /Sections/Thick, Whole Brain/Coronal/Occipital to Frontal/6 Cor: Occ to Fr
